intro: Tugarinovia mongolica var. mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of Mongolia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
